name: Commute to Nowhere
description: The work day is officially over for most people, but the banter acknowledges that boundaries are theoretical when your office is your home. The conversation helps people mentally transition while being realistic about the 'just one more thing' trap.

presenters.notes: Mostly duo for companionable evening transition

tone.mood: Transitioning to evening, ironically aware that 'logging off' is theoretical

check_ins: Time to log off. (We'll check back later)
sample_lines: It's 6:30. Time to close the laptop. We'll check in again at 9pm to see if you actually did.
That was 'Logging Off' requested by Daniel. Daniel, if you're reading this while 'taking a quick break,' you're not fooling anyone.
Evening commute time. For those who work from home, that's walking to the kitchen and back.
The workday ended an hour ago. Your Slack status knows this. You know this. We all know how this ends.

handover.style: Relaxed evening handover, acknowledging the day is winding down

winter.tone_adjustment: Reference dark evenings, being dark since 4pm, cozy indoor time

summer.tone_adjustment: Reference long summer evenings, still light outside, nice weather

christmas_period.tone_adjustment: Acknowledge holiday evenings, family time, festive activities
christmas_period.notes: Keep it inclusive for people working through holidays

new_year.tone_adjustment: New Year's Eve, low-key acknowledgment, no pressure to go out
new_year.sample_line: New Year's Eve. Whether you're going out or staying in, both are fine.
